ltRISK 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Estimate the age conditional probability of developing or dying from cancer

    ltr.Rd

    Estimate the age conditional probability of developing or dying from cancer

    ltr(mi, di, ri, ni, type = "developing", age_width = 5)

    Arguments

    mi

    The annual number of all-cause mortality deaths in each age group.

    di

    The annual number of cancer-related deaths in each age group.

    ri

    The annual number of diagnosed cancer cases in each age group.

    ni

    The number of population in each age group.

    type

    Characters "developing" or "dying" indicate estimate the probability of developing cancer or dying from it.

    age_width

    The age width of each age group.

    Value

    A list with class of ltr:

    age

    Age groups.

    si

    The probability of developing or dying from cancer in each age group.

    vari

    The variance of the estimates for each age group.

    Examples

    ni <- c(
  73872987, 82029530, 72267070, 78303514, 99425613, 119915673, 98068725,
  96644427, 121225951, 121250720, 96012917, 79863455, 75972753, 52929797,
  37551107, 29047207, 19584254, 13854299
)
mi <- c(
  60594, 17718, 18883, 28127, 37493, 75223, 83574, 100655, 211467, 278913,
  419663, 445223, 770865, 929008, 1058922, 1346942, 1576852, 2305312
)
di <- c(
  3511, 2801, 2553, 3183, 4960, 9456, 13509, 23935, 62386, 111640, 147866,
  203955, 301892, 304985, 302785, 323804, 275557, 197614
)
ri <- c(
  9303, 6887, 6248, 8509, 16961, 39439, 56670, 86535, 189251, 289320, 344395,
  411232, 552071, 491213, 433786, 395544, 292672, 173503
)
ll <- ltr(mi, di, ri, ni)
